message.content:
cs.SI, cs.SOC, cs.MA, cs.CE, cs.DS

Reasoning: 
1. cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) - The paper deals with the spread of information on a social network using an SI model, which falls under the scope of this sub-category.
2. cs.SOC (Social and Information Networks) - The paper also deals with social networks and their impact on information spreading, which is relevant to this sub-category.
3. cs.MA (Multi-Agent Systems) - The paper involves the optimization of controls for multiple agents (nodes/individuals) in a network, which is relevant to this sub-category.
4. cs.CE (Computational Engineering, Finance, and Science) - The paper involves the optimization of a campaign budget, which can be considered a financial optimization problem, falling under the scope of this sub-category.
5. cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) - The paper involves the allocation of resources over time and degree class groups, which can be considered an optimization problem involving data structures and algorithms, falling under the scope of this sub-category.
